First incoming events are decoded (the meaning of the numbers is added).

name: ----------- Select Position for incoming Workiece ----------
info:
If a workpiece is delivered by the vacuum gripper, the warehouse has to check for free positions. It therefore starts at position 11 and if the position is not free, it continues to the next one. If it finds no more free postion (warehouse is full) an error message should be deployed.
If a free position is found a comman is send to the warehouse

----------- Read the Stock of Warehouse 1 ----------

name: ----------- Check if the Warehouse and the Vacuum Gripper are ready and sen a command if available ----------
info:
After the commands have been stored in a list we check in regular intervals (every second) if there is a new comman available. If this is the cas and the warehouse_1 as well as the vacuum gripper_1 are available the command is ecxecuted.
The command contains the information which color of workpiece should be delivered. So the first thing we have to do is check wehere a workpiece of this color is still available. Therefore the flow checks everey position in the occupancy list and as soon as it enconters a searched workpiece it sends the command to the warehouse, that this one picks it and brings it to the vacuum gripper. At the same time the vacuum gripper recieves the command to pick a workpece at the warehouse.
If no more workpiece of this color is stored in the warehouse, this command is skipped and an error message is deployed

name: ----------- Send test commands to the vacuum gripper -----------
info: Just there for testing

name: ---------- Check in which slide and position a workpiece is stored -----------
info:
The sorting line pushes the workpieces into three drifferent slide. We want to depict this process also in out MES system. 
The slides have each 3 positions to store workpieces. So if the sorting line opens a valve to push a workpiece into a slide (event), the workpiece information (name and NFC-ID) should be stored in the list of this slide (each slide has one list/arry). So we first check if there there are already some workpieces in the concerned slide. When we find the first free position we store the informations there. When all 3 positions of one slide are occupied and the sorting line wanst to store an additional workpiece, an error message schould be deployed

name: command
info:
check which valve is opend an so identify the slide
in which the workpiece is dropped

name: ---------- Check if the ID provided by the Processing Station mateches the one of the NFC reader -----------
info:
When a net workpiece (NFC Tag) has beeen recognised 
by the NFC Reader, the identified Id is compared
to the one deliveren by the processing station stored
in the global variable global.sortingline.handover_workpiece

rules.to: The NFC ID of the new workpiece doesn't match

name: ------------ If a workpiece is placed at the Processing Station, the NFC ID should be handed over ----------
info: If the vacuum gripper transports it's workpiece to the processing station, the stored NFC_Id and name should be handed over. Then the processing station can check if these information match those recorded by the built-in NFC-Reader

name: ----------- Accept commands and store them in an Array----------
info:
The vacuum gripper recieves the commands to move workpieces from the sorting line to the warehouse 2. If a new command arrives, it is first stored in an array according to the first come first serve principle.

Commands can be send via the chatbot (and then over the IoT platform) or by clicking a button on the dashbaord

If the array for storing the commands (up to 9) is full, an error message is deployed

name: ----------- Excecute the commands stored in the Array----------
info: If there are any commands stored in the array, they should be deployed if possible. Therefore we will check if the vacuum gripper and the warehouse 2 are available. If then a command is stored in the list we will send this one to the vacuum gripper. The other commands (if there are any) will move one position forward.

name: Check if there is a cmd in pos 1
---------- Display the current commands ----------
info: The MES stores a list of commands that should be excecuted. This list and the current command should be diplayed in the dashboard

name: ---------- Display the current commands ----------
info: The MES hold a list of the commands in line. The first 5 entries as well as the currently executed command should be displaed in the dashboard

name: ----------- Store all the commands in an array ---------
info:
The MES stores new incomming commands in an array. As sson as the plant is ready for the excecution of the firs command of the list, this one is send to the plant.
The commands can be given via the three buttons in the dashboard or by sending them via the chatbot.
When a new command is incomming (independently of the origin) it is first checked if the plant is available and so can execute the command. When not the command is stored in the list and a notofication informs the user that the command is hold back.

The list can store upt to 9 commands (there are only 9 workpieces available). When the user wants to store more messages, an error notification is send out.

The following nodes coordinate the collaboration of warhouse 1 and vacuum gripper 1. Once the warehouse has successfully delivered a workpiece at the transfer position, it sends a command to the vacuum gripper to pick up the workpiece.

After the vacuum gripper has gripped the workpiece, this one sends a command to the warehouse, that this one can continue to bring back the empty palette

name: ----------- Reset all the Values to get the plant in its initial position ------------
info:
There exist 2 differnt ways to reset the values currently stored in the MES (this Node-RED instance). First it is possible to send a cammad via the chatbot (and then the cloud functions and to IoT platform). Then an event is coming from the blue IoT node 'commands'. 
The other possibility to reset the values is by clicking on the button on the dashboard

Onece the values have been reset successfully, a notification pops up to inform the user that he has to reboot the Fischertechnik controllers

rules.to: The plant has been reset. Please remember to restart the controllers.

name: ----------- Check if Sorting Line is ready for a new command ---------
info:
Checks if the sorting line is currently available.
When the sorting line starts to store a workpiece it is set unavailable. After the storing process, it is set available again

name: Comment
info:
If the raspberry Pi takes more than 15 seconds to respond, the flow continues.
This is implemented to prevent the process from stopping due to a problem an the side of the visual recognition. If this happens an error message is send to the dashboard

When we recieve an answer from the visual recognition, the timer is reset to prevent the flow from sending the command to continue twice

name: Check if Processing S. is waiting for a cmd

rules.to: Visual Recognition "No Valable Answer". Process has been continued

If the processing station is available (not producing any other workpiece) and the vacuum gripper has delivered a workpiece (workpiece has not been lost). these flows check if there is a new command which can be send to the plant. info:
When a net workpiece (NFC Tag) has beeen recognised 
by the NFC Reader, the identified Id is compared
to the one deliveren by the processing station stored
in the global variable global.processingstation.handover_workpiece

rules.to: The NFC ID of the new workpiece doesn't match

name: ----------- Check if Processing Station ia available ---------
info:
When the plant sends the event 2 it has finished its reference run and is available.
After dropping a piece to the sorting line with the event 18 the plant is available again

Wehen sending the event 47 the plant is busy

name: ----------- Check if Processing Station is waiting for a new command ---------
info: If the processing station is waiting for a command it sends the event 46 and if it has recieve an command it send the event 47

name: ----------- Check if Processing Station is ready for a new workpiece ---------
info:
We want to know if the moving tray of the oven is free (no workpiece placed there).
Only if this table is not occupied, the vacuum gripper 1 is allowed to place a workpiece.

This information is stored in the global variable 'gloabal.processingstation.ready_for_new_workpiece'


The tray is emty after a reference run (event 2) or after the crane of the processing station has moved a workpece to the turning table (event 8).
The tray is occupied after the vacuum gripper has dropped a workpiece at the processing station

name: ----------- Ping the IoT platform and send error message if no response ------------
info:
We are using a lite plan for the IoT platform. This one is deleted after 30 days on inactivity. Therefore the Cloud Node-RED should ping the IoT platform in regular intervals (e.g. every 24 h). So there is an activity.
In case that the Iot Platform has been deleted anyway a mail should be send by send to Jakob K. and Michael M. after 2 failed pings to inform them that something is not ok

rules.to: Guten Tag Patrick. Bei der Fischertechnik Anlage wurde ein Fehler festgestellt. Der Versuch die IoT zu erreichen ist leider fehlgeschlagen. Kannst du bitte mal nachschauen woran dies liegen könnte. Vielleicht wurde die IoT einfach nur nach 30 Tagen Inaktivität gelöscht. Um dis zu überprüfen musst du einfach in der Ressourcenliste der IBM Cloud (der practice) nach 'IoT Platform Fischertechnik Munich' suchen.

Guten Tag Jakob. Bei der Fischertechnik Anlage wurde ein Fehler festgestellt. Der Versuch die IoT zu erreichen ist leider fehlgeschlagen. Kannst du bitte mal nachschauen woran dies liegen könnte. Vielleicht wurde die IoT einfach nur nach 30 Tagen Inaktivität gelöscht. Um dis zu überprüfen musst du einfach in der Ressourcenliste der IBM Cloud (der practice) nach 'IoT Platform Fischertechnik Munich' suchen.

Guten Tag Michael. Bei der Fischertechnik Anlage wurde ein Fehler festgestellt. Der Versuch die IoT zu erreichen ist leider fehlgeschlagen. Kannst du bitte mal nachschauen woran dies liegen könnte. Vielleicht wurde die IoT einfach nur nach 30 Tagen Inaktivität gelöscht

name: Check if first ping failed already
Check if a mail has already be send
Comment about this flow
info:
this flow is partially responsible for the content of the first page of the Node-Red dashboard like the location, weather, ...
Furthermore the MES takes over some tasks that cant directly be assined to a unique model

name: Comment about this flow
info:
The following flow 'Warehouse_1_Display' (as the name already suggests) is responsible for the content of the warehouse_1 dasboard page.
Next to an image of the warehouse, current sensor values, an event log and the occupancy of the warehouse is displayed.

name: Comment about this flow
info:
The following flow 'Warehouse 1 Control' (as the name already suggests) is responsible for the controlling of the warehouse and to update the values in the MES system.
It works hand in hand with the previous flow 'Warehouse 1 Display'. Some of the values that are created here (the availability of the module) are then shown in the "Display Flow"

name: Comment about this flow
info: The following flow 'Vacuumgripper_1' is responsible for the controlling an diplay the events of the first vacuum gripper (used to transport workpieces from warehouse to processing station)

name: ----------- Check if the vacuum gripper has lost a workpiece -----------
info:
These nodes check if the vacuum gripper has lost a workpiece. therefore it checks first if the pressure value is below a abov threshold. Then it checks if the MES says, that the vacuum gripper should be moving a workpiece and is not only in IDLE mode.

Now if the vacuum gripper should be transporting a workpiece and the vacuum is to low to hold a workpiece, a message should be deployed to inform the user. Furthermore, the workpiece is deleted out of the module MES informations. So we can ensure, that the next module does not start.

name: Comment about this flow
info: The following flow 'Pro_Station_Display' is responsible for displaying the informations of the processing station

name: Comment about this flow
info: The following flow 'Pro_Station_Control' is responsible for the MES and controlling of the processing station. Some of the values created here are displaed in the 'Pro_Station_Display'-Flow

name: Comment
info: If the workpiece leaves the processing station via the conveyor belt, the values of the workpiece should also be deleted

name: Comment about this flow
info: The following flow 'Visual Recognition' is responsible launching the Visual recognition at the raspberry pi and to continue the process at the processing station sfter the visual recognition has been finished

name: Comment about this flow
info:
The following flow 'Sorting_Line' is responsible for displaing the events happening at the sorting line.

The sorting line doesn't accept commands. It acts completely independent. So the MEs does not take any controlling jobs. Hoever we are checking the NFC ID and so on.

name: Comment about this flow
info: The following flow 'Vacuumgripper_2' is responsible for the controlling an diplay the events of the first vacuum gripper (used to transport workpieces from warehouse to processing station)

name: ----------- Check if Vaccum Gripper 1 is available ---------
info:
If the plant is waiting for a command it sends the event 8.
When it has recieved a command it sends the event 9

name: comment
info: when the vacuum gripper is started, the warehouse 2 should start as well

name: Comment about this flow
info:
The following flow 'Warehouse_2_Display' (as the name already suggests) is responsible for the content of the warehouse_1 dasboard page.
Next to an image of the warehouse, current sensor values, an event log and the occupancy of the warehouse is displayed.

name: ------------ Get the picture of the hight bay warehouse ------------
info: These 2 nodes call the URL to get the image (stored in the IBM Cloud Object Storage) of the warehouse after a restart of the Node-RED instance. This image is then shown in the warehouse-page of the dashboard

name: ----------- Display Sensor Values ----------
info:
The next nodes display some sensor values of the warehouse. E.g. when the crane is moving in one direction, this should be shown with a green dot.

The display is always initialised as NOT active

name: ----------- Creating an event log of all incoming evens ----------
info:
First incoming events are decoded (the meaning of the numbers is added). 
Then the values are stored in an event log and the last 10 enties are displayed in the dashboard.

name: ---------- Set the initial Values of Warehouse 2 ----------
info: The MES system stores his information in gloabal vaiables. After a restart of the MES (be this after a new deployment of the Node-RED or after a reset command) the values should be reset (bring them to an initial state)

name: Comment about this flow
info:
The following flow 'Warehouse 1 Control' (as the name already suggests) is responsible for the controlling of the warehouse and to update the values in the MES system.
It works hand in hand with the previous flow 'Warehouse 1 Display'. Some of the values that are created here (the availability of the module) are then shown in the "Display Flow"

name: ----------- Check if all Modules of the Plant are available ------------
info:
Every module has one global variable which indicates if the module is currently available.
If one moudle changes it's availablity, the avalablity of the whole plant should be checked and stored in the cloudant datatabase

name: Check if Vacuum Gripper 1 is available
Check if Processing Station is available
Check if Sorting Line is available
Check if Vacuum Gripper 2 is available
Plant NOT available
Plant IS available
